thread.title: Gloria Borger: Trump’s Using Power of the Presidency and ‘Turning It Against an American Retailer’
thread.title_full: Gloria Borger: Trump’s Using Power of the Presidency and ‘Turning It Against an American Retailer’

author: Josh Feldman
title: Gloria Borger: Trump’s Using Power of the Presidency and ‘Turning It Against an American Retailer’

organizations.name: trump’s using power of the presidency

text:
Gloria Borger: Trump’s Using Power of the Presidency and ‘Turning It Against an American Retailer’ by Josh Feldman | 3:24 pm, February 8th, 2017 video 
A CNN panel this afternoon strongly criticized President Trump over his tweet slamming Nordstrom for dropping his daughter Ivanka ‘s brand. 
Brian Stelter highlighted how Sean Spicer said Nordstrom’s decision was a “direct attack” on the president’s policies, which he felt highlighted the administration’s “allergy to criticism.” 
Ryan Lizza said, “This is exactly what every ethics expert warned of… The message coming from the White House is ‘Make sure you don’t mess with our brands, make sure you don’t mess with our hotels, make sure you don’t take any public efforts that put our brand name in any bad light, or else.'” 
Gloria Borger then made this observation about what Trump’s tweet really gets at: 
He’s taking the power of the presidency and turning it against an American retailer because they failed to renew a contract with his daughter, which he says is because of his policies. 
Nia-Malika Henderson also said that being president is “supposed to be about public service,” not brands and profit. 
Watch above, via CNN.
